main_definition: A league is a group of teams or organizations that compete against each other, typically in sports, but can also refer to a geographical area with its own set of laws and culture.

meanings_and_examples.example: The English Premier League is an annual soccer league featuring 20 teams from England.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Geographical group of towns or cities
meanings_and_examples.example: In medieval times, the Holy Roman Empire was divided into leagues consisting of various counties and cities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Grouping based on shared interests or activities
meanings_and_examples.example: The League of Nations is an international organization founded in 1920 to promote peace and cooperation between countries.
